metadata.Title: CVE-2023-21843 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description: Vulnerability in the Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Editionproduct of Oracle Java SE (component: Sound). Supported versions that areaffected are Oracle Java SE: 8u351, 8u351-perf, 11.0.17, 17.0.5, 19.0.1;Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Edition: 20.3.8, 21.3.4 and 22.3.0. Difficult toexploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network accessvia multiple protocols to compromise Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVMEnterprise Edition. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result inunauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of Oracle Java SE,Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Edition accessible data. Note: This vulnerabilityapplies to Java deployments, typically in clients running sandboxed JavaWeb Start applications or sandboxed Java applets, that load and rununtrusted code (e.g., code that comes from the internet) and rely on theJava sandbox for security. This vulnerability does not apply to Javadeployments, typically in servers, that load and run only trusted code(e.g., code installed by an administrator). CVSS 3.1 Base Score 3.7(Integrity impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N).

criterions.comment: openjdk-8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
openjdk-9: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no longer supported by upstream').
